intro: Scilla bifolia var. alba, commonly known as the white scilla, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It blooms in late winter to early spring, adding early color to gardens and natural habitats. The white scilla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
